help.title: Help & Documentation
help.welcome: Welcome to Oxinot! A modern, block-based markdown outliner designed for flexible note-taking and knowledge management.
help.overview: Oxinot is a powerful block-based editor that combines outlining, markdown, and wiki-style linking. Your entire workspace lives as plain markdown files on your computer—no cloud, no lock-in, just your data.
help.selecting_workspace_steps:
1. Click the workspace name in the title bar center to select or create a workspace
2. Choose any folder on your computer to store your notes
3. Oxinot will scan for existing markdown files or create a fresh workspace
4. Your workspace path appears in the title bar for quick reference
help.creating_first_note_steps:
1. In the File Tree (left sidebar), click the **+ New page** button at the bottom
2. Enter a page title and press Enter
3. Start typing to create your first block
4. Use Tab to indent and Shift+Tab to outdent blocks
5. Press Enter to create a new block below
help.title_bar_content:
• **Navigation Arrows** - Go back/forward through your page history
• **Workspace Name** - Click to change workspaces
• **Clock** - Shows current time
help.file_tree_content:
• **Browse Pages** - See all your pages in a hierarchical tree
• **Drag & Drop** - Reorder pages or move them between folders
• **Create Pages** - Click **+ New page** to create top-level pages
• **Child Pages** - Click the **+** icon next to any page to create nested pages
• **Expand/Collapse** - Click the arrow icon to toggle showing nested pages
• **Delete Pages** - Right-click any page to access the context menu
• **Indent Guides** - Optional visual guides showing hierarchy (toggle in Settings)
help.block_editor_content:
• **Breadcrumb** - Shows your navigation path
• **Blocks** - Each line is a block that can be edited, formatted, and organized
• **Collapse/Expand** - Click the arrow next to blocks with children
• **Sub-pages** - See child pages of the current page
• **Linked References** - Shows pages linking to the current page
• **Block Selection Toolbar** - Appears when blocks are selected
help.creating_and_editing_content:
• **New Block** - Press Enter at the end of a block
• **Line Break** - Press Shift+Enter within a block (not a new block)
• **Edit** - Click any block to start editing
• **Delete** - Select a block and press Delete or use the context menu
help.formatting_content:
Oxinot supports markdown formatting:
• **Bold** - **text** or __text__
• **Italic** - *text* or _text_
• **Code** - `text` for inline code
• **Strikethrough** - ~~text~~
• **Links** - [text](url)
• **Headings** - # Heading 1, ## Heading 2, etc.
help.navigation_content:
• **Tab** - Indent (nest block under the previous block)
• **Shift+Tab** - Outdent (move block up one level)
• **Arrow Up/Down** - Move between blocks
• **Ctrl/Cmd+Arrow Up/Down** - Move block up or down in the list
• **Escape** - Deselect the current block
help.block_organization_content:
• **Collapse/Expand** - Click the arrow icon next to blocks with children
• **Drag Reordering** - Click and hold the bullet point to reorder blocks
• **Nested Lists** - Use indentation to create hierarchical lists
• **Multi-select** - Click blocks while holding Ctrl/Cmd to select multiple
• **Range Select** - Click a block, then Shift+Click another to select all between
help.block_actions_content:
Right-click any block to access:
• **Indent/Outdent** - Change nesting level
• **Delete** - Remove the block
• **Copy as Markdown** - Copy block as markdown text
• **Cut** - Move to clipboard
• **Duplicate** - Create a copy of the block
help.creating_pages_content:
• **Top-level** - Click **+ New page** in the File Tree
• **Child Pages** - Click the **+** icon next to a page name
• **From Editor** - Use the Command Palette to create pages
help.page_hierarchy_content:
• Pages are organized in a **tree structure** in the File Tree
• Nested pages appear indented under their parent
• Each page = one .md file in your workspace
• Move pages by dragging them in the File Tree
• Reparent pages by dragging them onto other pages
help.page_features_content:
• **Sub-pages Section** - Shows child pages at the bottom of the editor
• **Linked References** - Shows all pages that link to this page
• **Breadcrumb Navigation** - Click any parent in the breadcrumb to jump up
help.wiki_links_content:
Link to other pages using wiki-style syntax:
• **Link Format** - [[Page Name]]
• **Link to Child** - [[Parent/Child]]
• **Embedded Pages** - ![[Page Name]] embeds a page's content inline
• **Backlinks** - Linked References section shows all pages linking to you
help.embedded_content_content:
• **Embed Pages** - Use ![[Page Name]] to embed another page's blocks
• **Embed Blocks** - Reference specific blocks from other pages
• **Dynamic Updates** - Embedded content auto-updates when the source changes
help.block_metadata_content:
Add metadata to blocks for advanced organization:
• **Click the info icon** on any block to add metadata
• **Tags** - Organize blocks by topic
• **Properties** - Add custom key-value data
• **Search by Metadata** - Use metadata in queries and search
help.graph_visualization_content:
See how your notes are connected:
• **Open Graph** - Look for the graph icon or use the Command Palette
• **Full Graph** - Shows all pages and their connections
• **Page Graph** - Shows connections from a specific page
• **Adjust Physics** - Tweak repulsion, link distance, and collision radius
• **Drag Nodes** - Reposition nodes for better visibility
• **Zoom & Pan** - Scroll to zoom, click and drag to pan
help.daily_notes_content:
Create dated notes for journaling and daily tasks:
• **Open Calendar** - Look for the calendar icon or use the Command Palette
• **Create Daily Note** - Click a date to create/open a note for that day
• **Format** - Daily notes are named YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., 2024-01-15)
• **Highlights** - Dates with existing notes are highlighted
• **Today** - Click "Go to Today" button to jump to today's note
• **Organization** - Daily notes are separate from your main page hierarchy
help.command_palette_content:
The Command Palette gives you quick access to all app features:
• **Open** - Press Cmd+K (Mac) or Ctrl+K (Windows/Linux)
• **Search** - Type to find commands by name, description, keywords, or category
• **Run** - Press Enter or click to execute a command
• **Keyboard** - Some commands show their keyboard shortcuts
help.common_commands_content:
• **New Block** - Create a block after the current one
• **Delete Block** - Remove the focused block
• **Indent/Outdent Block** - Change nesting level
• **Copy Link** - Copy a wiki-link to the current page
• **Toggle Collapse** - Hide/show children blocks
help.search_content:
Find notes quickly across your entire workspace:
• **Open Search** - Look for the search icon or use Cmd/Ctrl+F
• **Full-text Search** - Searches page titles and block content
• **Results** - Shows matching blocks with context snippets
• **Navigate** - Click a result to jump to that block
• **Metadata Search** - Search by tags and properties
help.settings_content:
Customize Oxinot to your workflow:
• **Indent Guides** - Toggle visual hierarchy guides in blocks
• **Font Family** - Choose your preferred editor font
• **Font Size** - Adjust editor text size
• **Line Height** - Adjust spacing between lines
• **Theme** - Light or Dark mode
• **Color Variant** - Choose accent color (Blue, Purple, etc.)
• **Auto-save** - Changes save automatically as you type
help.productivity_shortcuts_content:
• **Cmd/Ctrl+K** - Open Command Palette
• **Cmd/Ctrl+F** - Open Search
• **Tab** - Indent block
• **Shift+Tab** - Outdent block
• **Escape** - Deselect block
• **Enter** - New block below
• **Shift+Enter** - Line break within block
help.best_practices_content:
1. **Use Descriptive Titles** - Page and block titles help with search
2. **Create Child Pages** - Keep pages focused and related content together
3. **Link Between Pages** - Use wiki-links to build your knowledge graph
4. **Collapse Large Sections** - Reduce visual clutter with collapsed blocks
5. **Tag Important Items** - Use metadata tags for quick filtering
6. **Daily Notes** - Journal daily to build a personal knowledge base
7. **Regular Backups** - Copy your workspace folder to cloud or external drive
help.organization_patterns_content:
• **Project Structure** - Create top-level page per project, with sub-pages for tasks
• **Subject-based** - Organize by topic (Books, Articles, Concepts, etc.)
• **Chronological** - Use daily notes as your main interface (like a journal)
• **Mixed** - Combine project pages, subject pages, and daily notes
• **GTD System** - Create Inbox, Projects, Someday, Reference structure
help.your_data_content:
• **No Cloud** - Everything stored locally on your computer
• **No Account** - No login required, no account to manage
• **Plain Text** - All files are standard markdown (.md) files
• **No Lock-in** - Export your data anytime by copying the folder
• **Open Format** - Compatible with any markdown editor
help.backup_strategy_content:
• **Automatic Backup** - Use cloud storage (Dropbox, iCloud, OneDrive, etc.) to sync your workspace folder
• **Git Version Control** - Initialize git in your workspace for full version history
• **Manual Backup** - Periodically copy your workspace folder to external storage
• **Multiple Locations** - Keep copies on your computer, cloud, and external drive
help.pages_not_loading_content:
• Check that your workspace folder path is correct
• Ensure the folder contains .md files
• Try switching workspaces and back
help.blocks_not_saving_content:
• Changes save automatically to disk
• Check file permissions in your workspace folder
• Ensure your workspace path is valid and writable
help.slow_performance_content:
• Try collapsing large nested sections
• Close pages with 1000+ blocks (split into smaller pages)
• Restart the app to free memory
help.shortcuts_table:
Command Palette | Cmd/Ctrl+K
Search | Cmd/Ctrl+F
New Block | Enter
Line Break | Shift+Enter
Indent | Tab
Outdent | Shift+Tab
Move Block Up | Cmd/Ctrl+Arrow Up
Move Block Down | Cmd/Ctrl+Arrow Down
Select Block | Ctrl/Cmd+Click
Range Select | Shift+Click
Deselect | Escape
